SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about answering all questions. Feel free to select those which are applicable to your experiences.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1941 and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Western Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Life: What Did You Do?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

( ) All Questionnaires

( ) Pioneer health conditions

( ) Pioneer social life, sports and recreation

( ) Pioneer housing

( ) Pioneer education and churchwork

( ) Pioneer farming experience

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Bansker Avenue, Sask.

A NOTE OF EXPLANATION TO THE PERSON COMPLETING THIS QUESTIONNAIRE:

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may fail to be applicable to yours; so don't worry about having had to answer them. Don't hesitate to give detailed or descriptive particulars where it seems necessary to answer the question.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914. It will not be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.
